restrictionInstructions.dataDistribution: DISTRIBUTION STATEMENT D: DISTRIBUTION AUTHORIZED TO DOD AND DOD CONTRACTORS ONLY. CRITICAL TECHNOLOGY, JULY 2012. OTHER REQUESTS SHALL BE REFERRED TO NAVSEA 07L. NO SECONDARY DISTRIBUTION AUTHORIZED WITHOUT WRITTEN APPROVAL OF THE APPLICABLE NAVSEA PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OFFICE.

dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

levelledPara.title: Regenerator/Condenser Heat Exchanger
levelledPara.para: The regenerator portion preheats the recycle gas leaving the blower motor while pre-cooling the recycle loop gas and water and liquid product vapor leaving the converter. The condenser portion then condenses the water and liquid product vapor into water and liquid product. The regenerator/condenser heat exchanger is a shell and tube type unit. Water and liquid product vapor flow through the tube core in both the regenerator portion and condenser portion. The regenerator shell is baffled to obtain eight passes of recycle gas leaving the blower. Cooling/pre-heating is accomplished by passing cooler (70 degrees F) recycle loop gas around the outside of the tube core containing the hotter (500 degrees F) recycle loop gas, water and liquid product vapor. The condenser shell is baffled to obtain four passes of CW around the tube core, condensing the water and liquid product vapor into water and liquid product, and cooling the recycle gases. The regenerator/condenser heat exchanger is located in the center of the BMP.
